column4: `umount: it seems /home/unity/Stuff is mounted multiple times` and only root is allowed to do -f

does anyone know how to, without root, unmount a fs marked with users option if it is mounted twice? if i try, i get `umount: it seems /home/unity/Stuff is mounted multiple times` and only root is allowed to do -f
sudo umount /where/ever
does that require that i know the root password?
it requires you to know your own password if you have access rights to mount and umount
but shouldn't users who do not have that right still be allowed to mount and umount thing marked with users option?
with the double mounting who knows
so is it like a kernel bug or something?
is mounting something twice a bug - perhaps
is mounting something twice a bug - though I think it is expected behaviour
I have been able to since the early I started using OSS in the early 90's
mount should check if it already mounted. i do not see why a user should be unable to mount something he or she mounted twice
just try it
try what? i have mounted something twice, and now it cannot be umounted
and if i mount it once, i CAN umount it
report it if your not happy
ok thanks for your help? do you know where it would be most appropriate to report?
launchpad.net say the steps and what you expect
is it relevant that the mount is smbfs?
perhaps then the report should go to samba instead?
samba
ok thanks again
